title: Parents of New Century's Evan Cranston sell down
text:
With short interest in colourful zinc producer New Century Resources rising and its share price 78.9 per cent off its peak, most of its directors and long-time spruikers are only too keen to stress their ongoing support.

For this reason, we found it intriguing that the parents of corporate lawyer and New Century board director Evan Cranston, who used to be executive chairman, instead spent the 12 months to July 1 decreasing their exposure.

Kingslane Pty Ltd is owned by John and Loreta Cranston, whose relationship to Cranston the younger was disclosed all the way back in the FY17 annual report (which also noted the $60,000 in rent New Century used to pay Kingslane).

Between the FY17 and FY18 annual reports, a period during which New Century's share price peaked at $1.52, Kingslane Pty Ltd had nearly doubled its holdings from 22,090,028 shares to 42,177,538. Mainly, it appears, through the conversion of convertible notes worth $4.5 million into ordinary shares on July 17, 2017. But by the end of FY19, Kingslane had shaved that stake to 36,757,534 shares – a decline of 5,420,004 shares, as detailed in this month's annual report.

These disposals would have, if sold on-market, netted anywhere between $7.3 million and $2.7 million, depending on the date.
description: Evan Cranston added another 100,000 shares to his tally in June. Which is small change compared to what his parents' company has been selling.
